title.narrative: STRENGTHENED DATA SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Strengthened national capacity to collect, analyze and use data and evidence on the situation of children, with focus on disparities and vulnerabilities.

sector.narrative: Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national capacity to collect, analyze and use data and evidence on the situation of children, with focus on disparities and vulnerabilities.

description.narrative: In 2019, the data environment underwent a positive change after the amendment of the Statistics Act in June 2019, which relaxed stringent regulations on statistics approval and release. The integration of child poverty data and analysis in Household Budget Survey reports is an important step in national capacity development for child poverty measurement and monitoring. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2020

title.narrative: Existence of disaggregated national household survey data on child-focused targets of SDGs collected within the preceding 5 years

baseline.value: Disaggregated national household survey data collected within the preceding 5 years exists on some child-focused targets of SDGs.

target.value: 2021:Disaggregated national household survey data collected within the preceding 5 years exists on all key child-focused targets of SDGs.

actual.value: 2020:Household Budget Survey 2017/2018 report, including data on child-focused targets of SDGs, was launched in December 2019

title.narrative: National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures

baseline.value: One child poverty analysis completed employing both monetary and multidimensional measures of poverty. Child poverty measurement not institutionalized within government.

target.value: 2021:Child poverty analysis employing both monetary and multidimensional measures of poverty institutionalized, routinely conducted and regularly used to report progress.

actual.value: 2020:2017/18 HBS Report for Tanzania Mainland and the 2018 Economic Survey report of the Ministry of Finance and Planning have included an analysis of monetary child poverty.
